div1.p: Hanson sends three cables from Bucaramanga about the yellow fever investigation and his travel plans.

div1.head: Three cables from Henry Hanson, September 5, 1923, September 6, 1923, September 16, 1923 [Enclosed in C0302047]
div1.p: Copy of Cables from Doctor Henry Hanson

Arrived September 3, 1923 Bucaramanga We have not had time
investigate conditions New cases reported consisting two Spanish
priests of which one died Will send a full report Stop
Can you give us address of where code book has been sent it not
having arrived

Budget yellow fever year 1924 estimated minimum $12,000 American
Gold monthly field work alone Make available in order to have
sufficient funds Stop Government will pay half cost
Board approximately $75,000 American Gold Missions Code received
Letter with full information follows

Please inform my wife . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Stop
We shall come to coast Barranquilla during the month of October
Appearances seem to indicate epidemic has passed away
